intro: Mesembryanthemum gariepense, commonly known as the Gariep mesem, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces vibrant yellow or orange blooms during the cooler months, often in spring or early summer. Mesembryanthemum gariepense is popular among succulent enthusiasts for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
